alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 2:49AM EDT until July 12 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain of 1 to 2 inches over the warned area, which has measured between 1 and 3 inches over the prior 24 hours. Excessive runoff is expected to cause small streams and brooks to flood, along with low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Colebrook, Errol, Dixville, Pittsburg, Stratford, Columbia, Dummer, Clarksville, Stewartstown and Wentworth Location.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
